lore: The day to say goodbye had come. Mikhail, Elinar, Vyre, Hexilo, and River ceased to be what they once were. Their last mission for the Auditors was carried out: to save not only the world, but the entire universe from an inexorable end. Their five new realms were ready, and the only thing that remained was saying goodbye. Everyone except Mortem and Tenebris set out on their journeys. "River," said the god of Blood. "It's Tenebris now, speak properly," he replied. "You weren't always so compliant with the rules." Tenebris smiled at his response. "You took Linta, you heathen." "I know, so I want to give you something." The Darksulker appeared next to Tenebris. Mortem knew Tenebris was raising an eyebrow under his cloak of darkness, even though he couldn't see it. "Come on, don't look at me like that. It's very smart, I've told it about you and it agreed. I'm sure you'll be great friends." The Gods embraced each other, so tightly that the earth itself trembled. "Goodbye, Mortem." "I'll miss you, Tenebris."
menagerieDialog: It's too warm in here. I hate being in enclosed spaces.
What kind of kingdom doesn't have a tavern? I wish I had been summoned by anyone else...
Do you enjoy playing chess? Perhaps we could play a game or two someday.
Why doesn't this castle have a door?
It's important to build a strong relationship with each of the gods. Without their help, {CASTLENAME} will never realize its true potential. Yes, that includes Torun.
name: Darksulker
